707537f-b.text:
First Ave., east side, north from East 23rd Street (foreground, not seen), showing in the background the Bellevue Hospital building outline. In the foreground, at the N.E. corner of East 23rd Street, appears a portion of the Institute for Crippled and Disabled. Occupying the S.E. corner of East 24th Street is a gasoline station. No. 2, of
this set shows the last mentioned features in detail.
May 8, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

707536f-a.text:
Looking north on First Avenue from 23rd Street.
March 5, 1928.
New York Edison Company Collection.
Neg. #2069

707538f-a.text:
First Avenue,West Side,23rd to 24th Streets,across excavation.
August 31,1930.

707532f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, south from and including East 23rd Street.
The Second Ave. Elevated is included.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707540f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 23rd., to,
but not including 26th Streets.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707539f-a.text:
First Ave., west side, south from East 24th., to 23rd Streets. Gas station in the foreground, is on the S.E. corner of East 24th Street.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

711628f-a.text:
23rd St. "L" Station 6-24-1942

P.L. Sperr, photographer
Neg. A-798

707533f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 23rd Street. The 2nd Avenue "gg" line veers on 23rd Street to connect with its designated thoroughfare. On the left is a gas station at the S. E. corner. This is of recent construction. Overhead are gasholders of the Consolidated Edison Company.
View 1: Say 8, 1938
View 2: July 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707533f-b.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 23rd Street. The 2nd Avenue "gg" line veers on 23rd Street to connect with its designated thoroughfare. On the left is a gas station at the S. E. corner. This is of recent construction. Overhead are gasholders of the Consolidated Edison Company.
View 1: Say 8, 1938
View 2: July 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
